description: ClickUp unifies tasks, docs, goals, and chat in a single platform, allowing teams to plan, organize, and collaborate across projects with customizable workflows

tools.name: CLICKUP_ADD_DEPENDENCY
tools.description: Adds a 'waiting on' or 'blocking' dependency to a task, requiring either `depends_on` (task becomes waiting on) or `dependency_of` (task becomes blocking), but not both; `team_id` is required if `custom_task_ids` is true.

inputSchema.title: AddDependencyRequest

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: Unique identifier of the task to which a dependency relationship will be added.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Team ID, required if `custom_task_ids` is true to look up tasks by custom IDs (unique per team).

depends_on.title: Depends On
depends_on.description: ID of the task that `task_id` will depend on ('waiting on' relationship). Use this or `dependency_of`, not both.

depedency_of.title: Depedency Of
depedency_of.description: ID of the task that will depend on `task_id` ('blocking' relationship). Use this or `depends_on`, not both.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: If true, `task_id` and related task IDs are custom (text-based), requiring `team_id`.

inputSchema.description: Parameters to create a dependency between two tasks.

tools.name: CLICKUP_ADD_GUEST_TO_FOLDER
tools.description: Adds a guest to a folder with specified permissions; requires a ClickUp Enterprise Plan.

guest_id.title: Guest Id
guest_id.description: The unique identifier of the guest user to be added to the folder.

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: The unique identifier of the folder to which the guest will be added.

include_shared.title: Include Shared
include_shared.description: If `true`, include shared item details (API default if parameter is omitted); if `false`, exclude them.

permission_level.title: Permission Level
permission_level.description: Permission level for the guest. Options are 'read' (view only), 'comment', 'edit', or 'create' (full access).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `AddGuestToFolder`

tools.name: CLICKUP_ADD_GUEST_TO_LIST
tools.description: Shares a ClickUp List with an existing guest user, granting them specified permissions; requires the Workspace to be on the ClickUp Enterprise Plan.

inputSchema.title: AddGuestToListRequest

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The unique numerical identifier of the List to which the guest will be added.

guest_id.title: Guest Id
guest_id.description: The unique numerical identifier of the guest user to be added to the List.

include_shared.title: Include Shared
include_shared.description: A boolean indicating whether to include details of items shared with the guest in the response. Set to `false` to exclude these details. If not provided or set to `true` (the API default), shared item details are included.

permission_level.title: Permission Level
permission_level.description: The permission level to be granted to the guest on this List. Accepted values are: `read` (view-only), `comment` (can add comments), `edit` (can edit existing items), or `create` (full access, including creating new items).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `AddGuestToList`

tools.name: CLICKUP_ADD_GUEST_TO_TASK
tools.description: Assigns a guest to a task with specified permissions; requires ClickUp Enterprise Plan, and `team_id` if `custom_task_ids` is true.

inputSchema.title: AddGuestToTaskRequest

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: The unique identifier of the task to which the guest will be added.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: Required if `custom_task_ids` is `true` to correctly identify the task when using a custom task ID.

guest_id.title: Guest Id
guest_id.description: The unique identifier of the guest user to be added to the task.

include_shared.title: Include Shared
include_shared.description: Optional. If set to `false`, details of items already shared with the guest will be excluded. The API defaults to `true` if this parameter is not explicitly set to `false`.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: Optional. Set to `true` if you are referencing the task by its custom task ID. If `true`, `team_id` must also be provided.

permission_level.title: Permission Level
permission_level.description: Permission level for the guest on this task. Must be one of: `read` (view only), `comment` (view and comment), `edit` (view, comment, and edit), or `create` (full permissions).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `AddGuestToTask`

tools.name: CLICKUP_CREATE_A_TIME_ENTRY
tools.description: Creates a new time entry for a specified team.

inputSchema.title: CreateATimeEntryRequest

end.title: End
end.description: Alias for `stop`. The end time of the time entry, as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds. If both `start` and `end` are provided, the API will use these to determine the entry's actual duration, potentially overriding the `duration` field sent in the request.

tid.title: Tid
tid.description: The ID of the task to associate this time entry with. If `custom_task_ids` is `true`, this should be the custom task ID.

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: The stop time of the time entry, as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds. If both `start` and `stop` are provided, the API will use these to determine the entry's actual duration, potentially overriding the `duration` field sent in the request.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: An array of Tag objects to apply to the time entry. Each Tag object should define 'name' (string), 'tag_fg' (hex color string for foreground), and 'tag_bg' (hex color string for background). This feature is available for users on the ClickUp Business Plan and above.

start.title: Start
start.description: The start time of the time entry, as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

team_Id.title: Team Id
team_Id.description: The ID of the Team (Workspace) to which the time entry will be added.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The ID of the Team, required only if `custom_task_ids` is set to `true`. This specifies the team context for the custom task ID. Example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: The user ID of the person to assign this time entry to. Workspace owners and admins can assign to any user ID. Workspace members can only assign to their own user ID.

billable.title: Billable
billable.description: Indicates whether the time entry is billable. Set to `true` if billable, `false` or omit if not.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The duration of the time entry in milliseconds. Note: If `start` and `end` (or `stop`) times are also provided in the request, the ClickUp API will calculate the duration based on `start` and `end`/`stop`, and this `duration` field's value might be ignored or overridden by the server.

description.title: Description
description.description: An optional description for the time entry.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: If `true`, the `tid` parameter will be interpreted as a custom task ID. If this is `true`, the `team_id` query parameter must also be provided to specify the team context for the custom task ID.

inputSchema.description:
Request schema for `CreateATimeEntry`. This model requires `start` and `duration` to be provided.
The ClickUp API itself might offer more flexibility (e.g., allowing `start` + `stop` without `duration` to define a completed entry, or only `start` to begin a timer).
However, when using this action, `start` and `duration` must be supplied in the request.

notify_all.title: Notify All
notify_all.description: If `True`, notifications for this comment will be sent to all members of the Chat view, including the comment creator. If `False`, notifications will follow standard ClickUp behavior.

comment_text.title: Comment Text
examples: Let's follow up on this tomorrow.
comment_text.description: The text content of the comment to be added.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for posting a comment to a Chat view.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids

tools.description: Creates a new folderless list (a list not part of any Folder) directly within a specified ClickUp Space.

inputSchema.title: CreateFolderlessListRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new folderless list.

status.title: Status
status.description: List color (e.g., 'red', 'blue_blended'), distinct from task statuses within the list. Null for no color.

content.title: Content
examples: List of all tasks related to Q1 marketing campaigns.

## Project Phoenix
All tasks for the new platform UI.
content.description: Description for the list (plain text or markdown).

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: `user_id` of the list owner. Null for no specific owner.

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: Due date for the list (POSIX timestamp in milliseconds).

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: Priority level: `1` (Urgent), `2` (High), `3` (Normal), `4` (Low). Null to remove priority.

space_id.title: Space Id
space_id.description: Identifier of the Space for the new folderless list.

due_date_time.title: Due Date Time
due_date_time.description: Indicates if `due_date` includes time (`true`) or is all-day (`false`). Required if `due_date` is set.

inputSchema.description: Request to create a new folderless list in a ClickUp Space.

tools.name: CLICKUP_CREATE_FOLDER_VIEW
tools.description: Creates a new, highly customizable view within a specific ClickUp folder using its `folder_id`.

inputSchema.title: CreateFolderViewRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: Name for the new view.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of view to create. Options include: `list`, `board`, `calendar`, `table`, `timeline`, `workload`, `activity`, `map`, `conversation`, or `gantt`.

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: Numeric ID of the folder where the new view will be created.

divide__dir.title: Divide  Dir
divide__dir.description: This field must be `null` (None). It is intended for specifying sort direction within divided sections, but its configuration is not fully detailed.

filters__op.title: Filters  Op
filters__op.description: Operator for combining filters. The available operator (`op`) values are `AND` and `OR`. Required when any filter parameter is provided.

divide__field.title: Divide  Field
divide__field.description: This field must be `null` (None). It is intended for view division features (e.g., swimlanes) whose specific configuration via this parameter is not fully detailed.

grouping__dir.title: Grouping  Dir
grouping__dir.description: Set a group sort order. Use `1` for ascending (e.g., urgent priority at top of the view, and tasks with no priority at the bottom) or `-1` to reverse the order (e.g., tasks with no priority at the top). Required when any grouping parameter is provided.

columns__fields.title: Columns  Fields
columns__fields.description: Array of field objects to display as columns in the view. Each element must be an object. Custom Fields require the `_cf` prefix followed by the Custom Field ID (e.g., `_cf_xxxxxxxx`).

filters__fields.title: Filters  Fields
filters__fields.description: Fields to filter by. Each element represents a filter condition. View the list of available fields in ClickUp's API documentation. Required when any filter parameter is provided.

filters__search.title: Filters  Search
filters__search.description: Text string to search for within tasks, comments, and subtasks in the view. Required when any filter parameter is provided.

grouping__field.title: Grouping  Field
grouping__field.description: Field to group tasks by. Options include: `none`, `status`, `priority`, `assignee`, `tag`, or `dueDate`. When any grouping parameter is provided, `grouping__field`, `grouping__dir`, `grouping__collapsed`, and `grouping__ignore` are all required.

sorting__fields.title: Sorting  Fields
sorting__fields.description: Fields to sort tasks by. Each element must be an object with 'field' and 'dir' properties. 'dir' should be 1 for ascending or -1 for descending. Refer to ClickUp API for the exact structure.

grouping__ignore.title: Grouping  Ignore
grouping__ignore.description: If `true`, tasks with no value for the `grouping__field` will not be grouped and will appear in a separate 'Ungrouped' section. Required when any grouping parameter is provided.

divide__collapsed.title: Divide  Collapsed
divide__collapsed.description: Array of identifiers for divided sections to collapse by default, or null if no sections should be collapsed.

grouping__collapsed.title: Grouping  Collapsed
grouping__collapsed.description: An array of group identifiers (e.g., status names like 'Open', assignee IDs as strings like '123') that should be initially collapsed in the view. These identifiers depend on the `grouping__field` used. Required when any grouping parameter is provided.

filters__show__closed.title: Filters  Show  Closed
filters__show__closed.description: If `true`, tasks with a closed status are included in the view.

settings__me__comments.title: Settings  Me  Comments
settings__me__comments.description: In 'Me Mode', if `true`, show only comments where the current user is mentioned or assigned.

settings__me__subtasks.title: Settings  Me  Subtasks
settings__me__subtasks.description: In 'Me Mode', if `true`, show only subtasks assigned to the current user.

settings__show__images.title: Settings  Show  Images
settings__show__images.description: If `true`, display task cover images or image attachments.

settings__me__checklists.title: Settings  Me  Checklists
settings__me__checklists.description: In 'Me Mode', if `true`, show only checklists assigned to the current user.

settings__show__subtasks.title: Settings  Show  Subtasks
settings__show__subtasks.description: Controls subtask visibility. Acceptable integer values are `1` (show subtasks as separate tasks), `2` (expand subtasks under parent tasks), or `3` (collapse subtasks under parent tasks).

team__sidebar__assignees.title: Team  Sidebar  Assignees
team__sidebar__assignees.description: List of user IDs (as strings). Tasks assigned to these users will appear in the 'Assignees' section of the team sidebar.

settings__show__task__locations.title: Settings  Show  Task  Locations
settings__show__task__locations.description: If `true`, display the List, Folder, and Space location for tasks. When any settings parameter is provided, a complete settings object with all settings keys is required.

settings__show__closed__subtasks.title: Settings  Show  Closed  Subtasks
settings__show__closed__subtasks.description: If `true`, include closed subtasks in the view.

team__sidebar__unassigned__tasks.title: Team  Sidebar  Unassigned  Tasks
team__sidebar__unassigned__tasks.description: If `true`, unassigned tasks will be shown in the team sidebar.

team__sidebar__assigned__comments.title: Team  Sidebar  Assigned  Comments
team__sidebar__assigned__comments.description: If `true`, comments assigned to users will be shown in the team sidebar.

settings__collapse__empty__columns.title: Settings  Collapse  Empty  Columns
settings__collapse__empty__columns.description: Specifies whether to collapse columns with no tasks (e.g., in Board view). Common string values are 'true' or 'false'.

settings__show__subtask__parent__names.title: Settings  Show  Subtask  Parent  Names
settings__show__subtask__parent__names.description: If `true`, display parent task names for subtasks.

inputSchema.description: Defines the request parameters for creating a new view within a ClickUp folder. This includes specifying the view's name, type, and various settings for grouping, sorting, filtering, and display.

tools.name: CLICKUP_CREATE_KEY_RESULT
tools.description: Creates a new Key Result (Target) for a specified Goal in ClickUp to define and track measurable objectives towards achieving that Goal.

inputSchema.title: CreateKeyResultRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The name for the new Key Result.

type.title: Type
type.description: Specifies the type of the Key Result, which determines how progress is tracked. Supported types: 'number', 'currency', 'boolean', 'percentage', 'automatic'.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: The unit of measurement for Key Results of type 'number', 'currency', or 'percentage' (e.g., '$', '%', 'items'). This may not be applicable for 'boolean' or 'automatic' types where progress is count-based.

owners.title: Owners
owners.description: A list of numerical user IDs to be assigned as owners of this Key Result.

goal_id.title: Goal Id
goal_id.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the parent Goal for which this Key Result is being created.

list_ids.title: List Ids
list_ids.description: An array of List UUIDs to link to this Key Result. Can be used with 'automatic' type Key Results to track progress based on tasks within these lists.

task_ids.title: Task Ids
task_ids.description: An array of task UUIDs to link to this Key Result. Often used when `type` is 'automatic' to track progress via the completion status of these linked tasks.

steps_end.title: Steps End
steps_end.description: The target value indicating Key Result completion. For 'boolean' type, use 1 for true/complete. For 'automatic' type, this is often the total count of items to complete (e.g., number of linked tasks).

steps_start.title: Steps Start
steps_start.description: The initial value for tracking Key Result progress. For 'boolean' type, use 0 for false/incomplete, 1 for true/complete. For 'automatic' type, this is often the initial count (e.g., 0).

inputSchema.description: Defines the request payload for creating a new Key Result (Target) for a Goal.

tools.name: CLICKUP_CREATE_LIST
tools.description: Creates a new list in ClickUp within a specified, existing folder.

inputSchema.title: CreateListRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The name to be assigned to the new list.

status.title: Status
status.description: Optional. Defines the list's color in the ClickUp UI (e.g., 'red', 'blue'). **Important:** This 'status' refers to the visual color of the list itself, not the workflow statuses (like 'To Do', 'In Progress') of tasks within the list.

content.title: Content
examples: Detailed plan for all Q3 marketing activities.
Tasks related to the initial phase of Project Alpha.
content.description: Optional descriptive content or notes for the list.

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: Optional. Numerical user ID of the assignee.

due_date.title: Due Date
due_date.description: Optional due date for the list, represented as a POSIX timestamp in milliseconds. For example, `1695110307000` for September 19, 2023, 07:58:27 AM GMT.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: Optional priority level for the list. Integer values map to: 1 (Urgent), 2 (High), 3 (Normal), 4 (Low).

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: The unique numerical identifier of the folder where the new list will be created.

due_date_time.title: Due Date Time
due_date_time.description: Optional. A boolean flag indicating whether the `due_date` includes a specific time. If `True`, the time component of `due_date` is respected. If `False` or not provided, the list is considered due on the entire day specified by `due_date`.

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: The unique identifier of the task to retrieve. This can be the standard ClickUp task ID or a custom task ID if `custom_task_ids` is set to `true` (in which case `team_id` is also required).

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The ID of the team. This parameter is required and used only when `custom_task_ids` is set to `true` to identify the custom task ID within that specific team. For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

include_markdown_description.title: Include Markdown Description
include_markdown_description.description: Set to `true` to return the task description in Markdown format. If omitted or `false` (default), the description is returned in plain text. For example: `?include_markdown_description=true`.

inputSchema.description: Specifies the task to retrieve and parameters for retrieval.

tools.name: CLICKUP_GET_TASKS
tools.description: Retrieves tasks from a specified ClickUp list; only tasks whose home is the given list_id are returned.

inputSchema.title: GetTasksRequest

page.title: Page
page.description: The page number of results to fetch, starting at 0. Each page can contain up to 100 tasks.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Filter tasks by a list of tag names. Use URL encoding for tags with spaces (e.g., 'this%20tag').

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: The ID of the list to retrieve tasks from. To find the list_id, copy the link to the list from the ClickUp UI; the list_id is the number following '/li' in the URL.

reverse.title: Reverse
reverse.description: Display tasks in reverse order based on the 'order_by' field.

order_by.title: Order By
order_by.description: Field to order tasks by. Valid options are: 'id', 'created', 'updated', and 'due_date'.

statuses.title: Statuses
statuses.description: Filter tasks by their status. Pass a list of status strings. Use URL encoding for statuses with spaces (e.g., 'to%20do'). To include closed tasks, use the `include_closed` parameter.

assignees.title: Assignees
assignees.description: Filter tasks by a list of assignee IDs.

due_date_gt.title: Due Date Gt
due_date_gt.description: Filter tasks with a due date greater than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

due_date_lt.title: Due Date Lt
due_date_lt.description: Filter tasks with a due date less than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

custom_items.title: Custom Items
custom_items.description: Filter by custom task types. For example: `?custom_items[]=0&custom_items[]=1300`. Including `0` returns tasks. Including `1` returns Milestones. Including any other number returns the custom task type as defined in your Workspace.

date_done_gt.title: Date Done Gt
date_done_gt.description: Filter tasks with a completion date greater than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

date_done_lt.title: Date Done Lt
date_done_lt.description: Filter tasks with a completion date less than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

custom_fields.title: Custom Fields
custom_fields.description: Filter tasks by custom field values. Provide a list of JSON strings, each defining a custom field filter. Example for a single filter: '[{"field_id":"field_id_1","operator":"=","value":"field_value_1"}]'. For multiple filters: '[{"field_id":"field_id_1","operator":"=","value":"field_value_1"}, {"field_id":"field_id_2","operator":"<","value":5}]'. See ClickUp API documentation for more on filtering with Custom Fields.

include_closed.title: Include Closed
include_closed.description: Include tasks with a closed status.

date_created_gt.title: Date Created Gt
date_created_gt.description: Filter tasks with a creation date greater than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

date_created_lt.title: Date Created Lt
date_created_lt.description: Filter tasks with a creation date less than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

date_updated_gt.title: Date Updated Gt
date_updated_gt.description: Filter tasks with an update date greater than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

date_updated_lt.title: Date Updated Lt
date_updated_lt.description: Filter tasks with an update date less than the provided Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

include_markdown_description.title: Include Markdown Description
include_markdown_description.description: Return task descriptions in Markdown format.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `GetTasks` action. It defines the parameters that can be used to filter and paginate tasks within a specific list.

team_id.description: The ID of the team (Workspace) to which the task belongs. This is required only when `custom_task_ids` is set to `true`. For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=1234567`.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: If set to `true`, the `task_id` parameter will be interpreted as a custom task ID. When using custom task IDs, the `team_id` must also be provided.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for `GetTaskSTimeInStatus`

tools.name: CLICKUP_GET_TIME_ENTRIES_WITHIN_A_DATE_RANGE
tools.description: Retrieves time entries for a specified Team (Workspace ID) within a date range (defaults to the last 30 days for the authenticated user if dates are omitted); active timers are indicated by negative durations in the response.

inputSchema.title: GetTimeEntriesWithinADateRangeRequest

list_id.title: List Id
list_id.description: Filter time entries to include only those associated with tasks in a specific List ID.

task_id.description: Filter time entries to include only those associated with a specific task ID. Use with `custom_task_ids` if referring to a custom ID.

team_Id.title: Team Id
team_Id.description: The ID of the Team (Workspace) for which to retrieve time entries.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The ID of the Team (Workspace) to use for context when `custom_task_ids` is `true`. This helps resolve custom task IDs. Example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

assignee.title: Assignee
assignee.description: Filter time entries by user ID(s). For multiple assignees, provide a comma-separated string of user IDs. Example: `1234,9876`. Note: Access to other users' time entries typically requires Workspace Owner/Admin privileges.

end_date.title: End Date
end_date.description: The end date of the date range for filtering time entries, specified as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds. If omitted, defaults to the current date.

space_id.title: Space Id
space_id.description: Filter time entries to include only those associated with tasks in a specific Space ID.

folder_id.title: Folder Id
folder_id.description: Filter time entries to include only those associated with tasks in a specific Folder ID.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: The start date of the date range for filtering time entries, specified as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds. If omitted, defaults to 30 days prior to the current date.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: Set to `true` if the `task_id` parameter refers to a custom task ID. If `true`, the `team_id` query parameter must also be provided for context.

include_task_tags.title: Include Task Tags
include_task_tags.description: If true, includes task tags in the response for time entries associated with tasks.

include_location_names.title: Include Location Names
include_location_names.description: If true, includes the names of the List, Folder, and Space in the response, along with their respective IDs (`list_id`, `folder_id`, `space_id`).

inputSchema.description: Request schema for retrieving time entries within a specific date range.

tools.name: CLICKUP_START_A_TIME_ENTRY

task_id.description: The unique identifier of the task to retrieve. This can be the standard ClickUp task ID or a custom task ID if `custom_task_ids` is set to `true` (in which case `team_id` is also required).

team_id.description: The ID of the team. This parameter is required and used only when `custom_task_ids` is set to `true` to identify the custom task ID within that specific team. For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

include_markdown_description.description: Set to `true` to return the task description in Markdown format. If omitted or `false` (default), the description is returned in plain text. For example: `?include_markdown_description=true`.

tools.name: CLICKUP_TRACK_TIME
tools.description: Records a time entry for a task using ClickUp's legacy time tracking system; newer endpoints are generally recommended.

inputSchema.title: TrackTimeRequest

end.title: End
end.description: The end time of the time entry, as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

time.title: Time
time.description: The duration of the time entry, in milliseconds. If `start` and `end` are both provided, this `time` field is ignored. If `time` is passed with `start` but no `end`, then `end` will be calculated. If `time` is passed with `end` but no `start`, then `start` will be calculated.

start.title: Start
start.description: The start time of the time entry, as a Unix timestamp in milliseconds.

task_id.title: Task Id
task_id.description: The unique identifier of the task to track time for.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The ID of the team. Required and used only if `custom_task_ids` is set to `true` to identify the task by its custom ID. For example: `custom_task_ids=true&team_id=123`.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: If `true`, the `task_id` is treated as a custom task ID. Requires `team_id` to be provided.

inputSchema.description: Request schema for tracking time on a task.

tools.name: CLICKUP_UPDATE_A_TIME_ENTRY
tools.description: Updates an existing ClickUp time entry; provide `start` and `end` times together, and include `team_id` as a query param (request field `team_id_1`) if `custom_task_ids` is true.

inputSchema.title: UpdateATimeEntryRequest

end.title: End
end.description: New end time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds). If provided, `start` must also be provided.

tid.title: Tid
tid.description: The ID of the task for this time entry; if `custom_task_ids` is `true`, this should be the custom task ID.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: List of tag objects (e.g., `{'name': 'your-tag'}`) for the time entry. Time tracking labels are for Business Plan and above users.

start.title: Start
start.description: New start time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds). If provided, `end` must also be provided.

team_id.title: Team Id
team_id.description: The Team (Workspace) ID, as a query parameter; required if `custom_task_ids` is `true`.

billable.title: Billable
billable.description: Indicates whether the time entry is billable.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: New duration of the time entry in milliseconds; can be an alternative to `start` and `end` times.

timer_id.title: Timer Id
timer_id.description: The unique identifier of the time entry to update. Path parameter.

description.title: Description
examples: Completed initial draft of the report
description.description: A new description for the time entry.

custom_task_ids.title: Custom Task Ids
custom_task_ids.description: If `true`, `tid` is interpreted as a custom task ID, and the `team_id` query parameter (request field `team_id_1`) must also be provided.

inputSchema.description: Schema for the request to update an existing time entry.

tools.name: CLICKUP_UPDATE_VIEW
tools.description: Updates an existing ClickUp view's settings such as name, type, grouping, or filters; ensure `parent_id` and `parent_type` define a valid hierarchy, and that specified field names (e.g. for sorting, columns) are valid within the ClickUp workspace.

inputSchema.title: UpdateViewRequest

name.title: Name
name.description: The new name for the view.

view_id.title: View Id
view_id.description: The unique identifier of the view to be updated.

parent__id.title: Parent  Id
parent__id.description: The ID of the Workspace, Space, Folder, or List where the view is located.

divide__dir.title: Divide  Dir
divide__dir.description: The direction for dividing the view. Currently, this field may not be actively used or may be deprecated.

filters__op.title: Filters  Op
filters__op.description: The operator for combining filters. Available values are `AND` and `OR`.

parent__type.title: Parent  Type
parent__type.description: The level of the Hierarchy where the view is created. Options include: Workspace (Everything Level): `7`, Space: `4`, Folder: `5`, List: `6`.

divide__field.title: Divide  Field
divide__field.description: The field to divide the view by (e.g., to create swimlanes in a board view). Currently, this field may not be actively used or may be deprecated.

grouping__dir.title: Grouping  Dir
grouping__dir.description: The sort order for grouping. Use `1` for ascending (e.g., urgent priority at the top) or `-1` for descending (e.g., no priority at the top).

columns__fields.title: Columns  Fields
columns__fields.description: Fields to display as columns in the view. Custom Fields require the `_cf` prefix and their ID (e.g., `_cf_custom_field_id`).

filters__fields.title: Filters  Fields
filters__fields.description: Fields to apply filters on; refer to ClickUp API documentation for available fields.

filters__search.title: Filters  Search
filters__search.description: A search string to filter tasks by name or content.

grouping__field.title: Grouping  Field
grouping__field.description: The field to group tasks by. Options include: `none`, `status`, `priority`, `assignee`, `tag`, or `dueDate`.

sorting__fields.title: Sorting  Fields
sorting__fields.description: Fields to sort tasks by; refer to ClickUp API documentation for available filter fields.

grouping__ignore.title: Grouping  Ignore
grouping__ignore.description: If true, tasks with no value for the `grouping_field` will not be grouped.

divide__collapsed.title: Divide  Collapsed
divide__collapsed.description: Indicates if divided sections should be collapsed. Currently, this field may not be actively used or may be deprecated.

grouping__collapsed.title: Grouping  Collapsed
grouping__collapsed.description: A list of group identifiers (e.g., status names or assignee IDs) that should be collapsed by default in the view.

filters__show__closed.title: Filters  Show  Closed
filters__show__closed.description: If true, closed tasks will be included in the view.

settings__me__comments.title: Settings  Me  Comments
settings__me__comments.description: If true, in 'Me Mode', only comments where the current user is mentioned or involved will be shown.

settings__me__subtasks.title: Settings  Me  Subtasks
settings__me__subtasks.description: If true, in 'Me Mode', only subtasks assigned to the current user will be shown.

settings__show__images.title: Settings  Show  Images
settings__show__images.description: If true, images attached to tasks will be displayed in the view (e.g. cover images in card view).

settings__me__checklists.title: Settings  Me  Checklists
settings__me__checklists.description: If true, in 'Me Mode', only checklists assigned to the current user will be shown.

settings__show__subtasks.title: Settings  Show  Subtasks
settings__show__subtasks.description: Controls how subtasks are displayed. Acceptable values are `1` (show subtasks as separate tasks), `2` (show subtasks expanded under parent task), or `3` (show subtasks collapsed under parent task).

team__sidebar__assignees.title: Team  Sidebar  Assignees
team__sidebar__assignees.description: A list of assignee user IDs to feature in the team sidebar.

settings__show__assignees.title: Settings  Show  Assignees
settings__show__assignees.description: If true, assignees will be displayed on tasks.

settings__show__task__locations.title: Settings  Show  Task  Locations
settings__show__task__locations.description: If true, task locations (List, Folder, Space) will be displayed.

settings__show__closed__subtasks.title: Settings  Show  Closed  Subtasks
settings__show__closed__subtasks.description: If true, closed subtasks will be included in the view.

team__sidebar__unassigned__tasks.title: Team  Sidebar  Unassigned  Tasks
team__sidebar__unassigned__tasks.description: If true, unassigned tasks will be shown in the team sidebar.

team__sidebar__assigned__comments.title: Team  Sidebar  Assigned  Comments
team__sidebar__assigned__comments.description: If true, assigned comments will be shown in the team sidebar.

settings__collapse__empty__columns.title: Settings  Collapse  Empty  Columns
settings__collapse__empty__columns.description: If true, columns with no tasks will be collapsed (e.g., in Board view). This might accept boolean as a string like 'true' or 'false'.

settings__show__subtask__parent__names.title: Settings  Show  Subtask  Parent  Names
settings__show__subtask__parent__names.description: If true, parent task names will be displayed for subtasks.
